formula: G.f.: (1-x)/(1-x-3*x^2).a(n) = A006130(n) - A006130(n-1).Recurrence: {a(1)=0, a(0)=1, 3*a(n)+a(n+1)-a(n+2)=0}.Sum(1/13*(-1+7*_alpha)*_alpha^(-1-n), _alpha=RootOf(-1+_Z+3*_Z^2)).a(n) = sum{k=0..floor(n/2), C(n-k-1,n-2k)*3^k}. - _Paul Barry_, Mar 16 2010If p[1]=0, and p[i]=3, (i>1), and if A is Hessenberg matrix of order n defined by: A[i,j]=p[j-i+1], (i<=j), A[i,j]=-1, (i=j+1), and A[i,j]=0 otherwise. Then, for n>=1, a(n)=det A. - _Milan R.
